intro: Astragalus macroptilus var. viridiuscula, commonly known as the greenish milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are compound, with numerous small leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. This variety is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
